monster.name: Barixis the Undying

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If Barixis fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Negative Energy Cone
entries: Barixis' central eye emits an {@condition invisible}, magical 60-foot cone of negative energy. At the start of each of its turns, Barixis decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. Any creature in that area cannot regain hit points.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever Barixis is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Barixis has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reconstruction (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: If Barixis would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 275 hit points and it regains all uses of its legendary resistance and any expended spell slots. Additionally, Barixis can use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for one hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating Barixis after its reconstruction occurs.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Barixis has its phylactery, once destroyed it gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all of its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: Barixis does not require food or drink.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d10 + 13}) piercing damage.

action.name: Psychic Barrage {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}68 ({@damage 10d10 + 16}) psychic damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
1.Charm Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.

2.Paralyzing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
5. Enervation Ray. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

6. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the target is an object weighing 500 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

7. Sleep Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

8. Petrification Ray. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

9. Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 63 ({@damage 14d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.
10. Death Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 77 ({@damage 14d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

reaction.name: Spellcasting Awareness
entries: Barixis can use two reactions each turn. These reactions are reserved for the use of {@spell counterspell}.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: Barixis uses one random Eye Ray.

legendary.name: Psychic Barrage Recharge
entries: Barixis rolls to recharge its Psychic Barrage

legendary.name: Psychic Barrage (Costs 2 Actions, must be charged)
entries: Barixis uses its psychic barrage.

mythicHeader: If Barixis' reconstruction trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Telekinetic Ray
entries: Barixis uses its Telekinetic Eye Ray

mythic.name: Sphere of Obliviation (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Barixis engulfs one creature {@condition restrained} by its Telekinetic Ray into its central eye. A creature engulfed in this manner must succeed on a {@dc 23} constitution saving throw or die. The target takes 82 ({@damage 15d10}) necrotic damage on a success, and is left {@condition prone} in a space adjacent to Barixis.

Barixis is quite large in terms of a beholder - its green and blue metallic and scaly body is about 6 feet in diameter, with 4 long thin stalks sprouting ending in silvery eyes. It has a large sharp toothed grin and, most noticeably, a deep pit where its large central eye should be. Below its body, rudely grafted into its skin, are 8 adamantine legs, along with 2 additional adamantine stalks protruding from its body.

In life, Barixis was a powerful beholder with well developed arcane abilities. It sought out the power of immortality through magical means and was able to bind its soul to a phylactery, at the cost of never being satisfied with the death of others.In time many tried to kill the great Barixis, even piercing its eye to blind its, but with arcane skill it rebuilt its body and turned to magic to continue fighting and collecting souls.

After centuries of operating an arena and collecting the souls of those who fought to feed his phylactery, the arena slowly became its own domain, separated from the material plane, and there Barixis subjected his prisoners to endless battles, slowly feeding on their souls for eternity.

trait.name: Reflective Shell
entries: Any time Humpty Dumpty is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, Humpty Dumpty is unaffected. On a 6, Humpty Dumpty is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from Humpty Dumpty, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Humpty Dumpty can't be affected or detected by spells of 4th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Humpty Dumpty's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Critical Hit Immunity
entries: Humpty Dumpty's adamanting plating prevents it from being affected by critical hits

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Humpty Dumpty fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Slow Moving
entries: Humpty Dumpty cannot take the Dash action

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Humpty Dumpty makes 4 swipe attacks and throws up to one {@condition grappled} creature

action.name: Swipe Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 3d6 + 20}) bludgeoning damage. If the attack is with a hand holding a {@condition grappled} creature, that creature also takes the damage. If the target is huge or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} by Humpty Dumpty. Humpty Dumpty can grapple up to 4 creatures in this manner.

action.name: Throw
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}41 ({@damage 6d6 + 20}) bludgeoning damage. If Humpty Dumpty hits another creature, both the target and the thrown creature take the damage, otherwise only the thrown creature takes the damage.

action.name: Stomp (recharge  5-6)
entries: Humpty Dumpty stomps and all creatures within 60 ft musc make a {@dc 26} dexterity saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning and 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire damage as cracks spout in the earth erupting molten egg yolk

legendary.name: Attack (costs 1 action)
entries: Humpty Dumpty moves up to his speed and makes a Swipe attack

legendary.name: Throw (costs 2 actions)
entries: Humpty Dumpty makes a Throw attack

legendary.name: Stomp (costs 3 actions)
entries: Humpty Dumpty recharges and uses its Stomp attack

action.name: Give chase
entries: The eggs with legs chase the nearest creature, using the dash action until they are able to explode.

reaction.name: Explode
entries: When a creature is within 10 feet of the eggs with legs, it explodes. All creatures within 10 feet must make a {@dc 26} constitution save or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage and is {@condition poisoned}. On a pass, the creature only takes the piercing damage.

trait.name: Jack(rabbit) of all trades
entries: The Easter Bunny can add its proficiency bonus to any ability check it makes

trait.name: Insane Hops
entries: The Easter Bunny can jump up to 120 ft

trait.name: Super Speeeeedy
entries: The Easter Bunny moves so fast he always appears in two places. This grants the Easter Bunny advantage on melee attack rolls while this trait is active. Also, whenever an attack roll hits the Easter Bunny, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 3-6 that attack misses instead. If an attack hits, then this trait is inactive until the Easter Bunny moves. It is also inactive while the Easter Bunny is {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition restrained}, or otherwise unable to move.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the easter bunny fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the the easter bunny is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the the easter bunny instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Easter Bunny makes up to 6 carrot shank attacks or egg toss attacks

action.name: Carrot Shank
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 5d8 + 20}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Egg Toss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}41 ({@damage 6d6 + 20}) damage. The Easter Bunny can choose the damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

action.name: Fists of Furry {@recharge 4}
entries: The Easter Bunny chooses up to five creatures within 120 ft, and makes two unarmed strike attacks against each, landing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of one of the targets. Moving from creature to creature does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

bonus.name: Insane Hops
entries: The Easter Bunny jumps up to 120 ft without provoking an attack of opportunity

reaction.name: Fast Reactions
entries: The Easter Bunny can take 3 reactions.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker hits the Easter Bunny, it can use a reaction to halve the damage of that attack.

reaction.name: Extra Opportunity
entries: Whenever the Easter Bunny takes an opportunity attack, it can make two attacks instead of one

legendary.name: Hop (costs 1 action)
entries: The Easter Bunny uses its Insane Hops ability then makes one attack

legendary.name: Energize (costs 2 actions)
entries: The Easter Bunny rolls to recharge Fists of Furry

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Snead is a 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Snead van Veld has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Knights
entries: Unless Snead is {@condition incapacitated}, he and other creatures of its choice within 60 feet of him have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Snead makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Radiant Orb (1/Day)
entries: Snead hurls a magical ball of light that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Snead adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, he must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Flying Spaghetti Monster

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects. It is not immune to spells that cause acid, cold, or poison damage.

trait.name: Divine Invulnerability
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster cannot be targeted or affected by attacks or spells until its Avatars have been defeated. While vulnerable, it can take no more than 300 damage before it becomes invulnerable again. When the Flying Spaghetti Monster reaches 0 hit points, it does not die, but fades back to the Pastafaria where it recovers from its loss.

trait.name: Rage of the Ravioli
entries: If the Flying Spagetti Monster is reduced to below 300 hit points, it regains all of its health and gains access to its Mythic Actions. Once this trait has been activated, it cannot be used again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Omniscient
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster cannot be surprised, and always acts first in combat. The flying spaghetti monster knows all spells.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster's spellcasting ability is Intelligence. (Spell Save {@dc 27}, {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the flying spaghetti monster fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Burden of Proof
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster can choose to emanate an anti-illusion field with a radius of 60 ft. This functions similar to {@spell antimagic field} but only for magic from the school of illusion.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster makes any combination of five Noodly Appendage or Spicy Meatball attacks

action.name: Noodly Appendage
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 2d12 + 16}) bludgeoning damage + 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 23})

action.name: Spicy Meatball
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Carb Coma {@recharge 4}
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster unleashes a wave of lethargy. All creatures of its choice are subjected to the effects of {@spell slow} until the end of their next turn, and must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or also take a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

reaction.name: Summon Avatars
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster summons {@dice 1d6} Avatars of Ittehgaps ({@dice 1d6 + 1d4} Greater Avatars if the Rage of the Ravioli trait has been activated) and immediately becomes invulnerable. This reaction can only be taken if it is vulnerable and falls below 600 hit points. It cannot take any other reactions this turn.

reaction.name: Summon Greater Avatars
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster summons {@dice 1d4} Greater Avatars of Ittehgaps ({@dice 1d6} if the Rage of the Ravioli trait has been activated) and immediately becomes invulnerable. This reaction can only be taken if it is vulnerable and falls below 300 hit points. It cannot take any other reactions this turn.

reaction.name: Counterspell (2/turn)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti monster casts {@spell counterspell} at 5th level.

legendaryHeader: The flying spaghetti monster can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The flying spaghetti monster regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs one action)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster makes two Noodly Appendage or Spicy Meatball attacks.

legendary.name: Touched by the Noodle (Costs two actions)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster targets any creature it can see, granting it a moment of clarity - gaining the understanding that the Flying Spaghetti Monster is not truly the enemy. That creature must make a {@dc 23} intelligence saving throw, or immediately use its reaction to attack an ally.

legendary.name: Cast Spell - Level 0-3 (Costs one action)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster casts any spell of 3rd level or lower at 3rd level.

legendary.name: Cast Spell - Level 4+ (Costs two actions)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster casts any spell of 6th level or lower at 6th level.

mythicHeader: The flying spaghetti monster gains the following options as Legendary Actions only after the Rage of the Ravioli has been activated

mythic.name: Disprove Existence (Costs one action)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster targets one creature. That creature must pass a {@dc 23} intelligence saving throw or cease to exist until the end of its next turn. The third time a creature is affected by this, its existence is permanently erased, and it is forgotten.

mythic.name: Omnipotence (Costs two actions)
entries: The Flying Spaghetti Monster casts any spell at 9th level

Ruling from the Plane of the Pastafaria, the Flying Spaghetti Monster knows all, and uses its divine logic to disprove the existence of other, false, deities. On occasion, it will show itself to inspire creatures with the touch of its noodly appendage.

trait.name: Wrap In Tendrils
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps may choose to halve its attack damage on a successful hit to reduce its target's movement speed to 0ft until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Magical Attacks
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps' attacks count as magical and divine for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. It gains advantage on attacks against any creature that shares its space.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Writhing Multiattack
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps makes 3 attacks with its Writhing Noodles attack.

action.name: Writhing Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 21}. The target may use its action on its turn to attempt to break the grapple.

action.name: Polpettapult
entries: Up to two target creatures of the Avatar of Ittehgaps' choice within 50 feet must make a {@dc 21} dexterity saving throw as chunks of meat fly through the air towards them. Each target takes 46 ({@damage 8d6 + 18}) bludgeoning damage, and all creatures within 5 feet of the target take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage. The target takes half damage on a successful save, and creatures within 5 feet of the target take no damage from this action.

legendary.name: Writhing Attack (Costs 1 Actions)
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps makes one Writhing Attack against a target in range.

legendary.name: Fatal Attraction (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps creates a tendril between two enemies of its choice within 120 feet of itself. Both of these targets must succeed a {@dc 18} CHARISMA saving throw. Any target that fails must spend the next minute attempting to devour the other target via unarmed strikes with its bites, but may re-attempt the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. For the duration of the charm, an affected target's unarmed attacks made as a bite deal 14 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and have advantage if the target is wounded. An affected target may not choose another target until the charm is broken on it.

trait.name: Wrap In Tendrils
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps may choose to halve its attack damage on a successful hit to reduce its target's movement speed to 0ft until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Magical Attacks
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps' attacks count as magical and divine for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. It gains advantage on attacks against any creature that shares its space.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Writhing Multiattack
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps makes 3 attacks with its Writhing Noodles attack.

action.name: Writhing Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 22}. The target may use its action on its turn to attempt to break the grapple.

action.name: Polpettapult
entries: Up to two target creatures of the Avatar of Ittehgaps' choice within 50 feet must make a {@dc 22} dexterity saving throw as chunks of meat fly through the air towards them. Each target takes 52 ({@damage 10d6 + 17}) bludgeoning damage, and all creatures within 5 feet of the target take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage. The target takes half damage on a successful save, and creatures within 5 feet of the target take no damage from this action.

action.name: Pappardelle Piano {@recharge 5}
entries: The avatar chooses a 30 ft square within 90 feet. Grasping squirming noodles in marinara erupt from the ground in the area. For the next three rounds, or until this feature is activated again, this pasta turns the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} by the noodles until the effect ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tentacles takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

legendary.name: Writhing Attack (Costs 1 Actions)
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps makes one Writhing Attack against a target in range.

legendary.name: Fatal Attraction (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Avatar of Ittehgaps creates a tendril between two enemies of its choice within 120 feet of itself. Both of these targets must succeed a {@dc 19} charisma saving throw. Any target that fails must spend the next minute attempting to devour the other target via unarmed strikes with its bites, but may re-attempt the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. For the duration of the charm, an affected target's unarmed attacks made as a bite deal 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and have advantage if the target is wounded. An affected target may not choose another target until the charm is broken on it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The giant mantis shrimp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sexnocular Vision
entries: The giant mantis shrimp has exceptional vision that makes it impossible to be flanked, and gives it advantage on all ability checks that rely on sight. It can also see into any coexistent planes to the one it is currently in.

trait.name: Ethereal Presence
entries: The giant mantis shrimp exists in both the material and ethereal planes and can both see and effect creatures in either plane.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The giant mantis shrimp deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Dismembering Strike
entries: When the giant mantis shrimp rolls 18-20 on its Dactyl Club attack die, roll a {@dice d100}, using the results below:
1-80: The attack deals normal critical damage - 72 ({@damage 14d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

81-98: roll the damage dice for the attack three times - 103 ({@damage 21d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. The target must pass a {@dc 26} constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn

99-100: roll the damage dice for the attack four times - 134 ({@damage 28d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If this attack reduces the target to 0 HP, its head explodes from the impact and the target dies.

trait.name: Boiling Strike
entries: If underwater, all attacks with the Dactyl Club cause the water in the immediate vicinity to briefly cavitate. Each time a Dactyl Club attack is made, the target and all creatures within 5 ft of the target take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage as a result. If any creature in that area is wearing metal armor, they must pass a {@dc 22} dexterity saving throw or the AC bonus of that armor (including magical armor) is reduced by 1 until the beginning of the giant mantis shrimp's next turn. If at any point the AC bonus is reduced to 0 due to this effect, the armor is destroyed.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the giant mantis shrimp is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the giant mantis shrimp is unaffected. On a 6, the giant mantis shrimp is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the giant mantis shrimp, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the giant mantis shrimp fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant mantis shrimp makes four dactyl club attacks

action.name: Dactyl Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}41 ({@damage 7d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. Due to the speed of the attack, the giant mantis shrimp attacks with advantage unless subjected to the {@spell slow} spell

action.name: Searing Stream {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant mantis shrimp unleashes a line of searing heat 10 feet wide and 60 ft long. All creatures in its path must make a {@dc 22} dexterity saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage, or half on a success

bonus.name: Rapid Escape
entries: The giant mantis shrimp moves up to it's speed without provoking attacks of opportunity. All creatures within 5 feet of its movement path are subjected to the effects of it's boiling strike.

reaction.name: Pre-Emptive Defense
entries: When an attack would hit, the giant mantis shrimp attempts to parry  and gains +3 to its AC against that attack. This can be activated once per turn, and when it is triggered, boiling strike is also triggered.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The giant mantis shrimp makes one Dactyl Club attack

legendary.name: Lunging Strike (Costs 2 actions)
entries: The giant mantis shrimp moves up to it's speed and makes a Dactyl Club attack. All creatures within 5 feet of its movement path are subjected to the effects of it's boiling strike.

legendary.name: Cavitation (Costs 3 actions)
entries: The giant mantis shrimp shudders so quickly that it causes all water within 15 ft to cavitate. Intense light and heat come from this cavitation and all creatures within the area must make a DC24 constitution saving throw. On failure, they are {@condition blinded} for one minute and take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) fire damage. On success, they are not {@condition blinded} and only take half damage. A creature who is {@condition blinded} can repeat this save at the end of each of their turns.

The peacock mantis shrimp - Odontodactylus scyllarus - one of deadliest predators of the ocean, a terror of the deep. It moves so quickly that it causes the water around it to cavitate, and packs a punch so hard it can crush a skull. The bright colors are a warning: if you see it - run.
